newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish central bank sells CDs at unchanged rate.
newsitem.headline: Danish central bank sells CDs at unchanged rate.

text.p: Denmark's central bank said on Friday it offered to sell 14-day certificates of deposit (CDs) at a fixed yield of 3.50 percent, unchanged from the previous two-week offer.
The bank steers money market rates and liquidity through its 14-day certificates of deposit (CDs) deals and state paper repos.
The central bank discount and key deposit rates were unchanged at 3.25 percent. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969652
